verses.kjv: Surely there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they fine it.
verses.ct: There are mines where silver is found, and places where gold is refined.

verses.kjv: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is molten out of the stone.
verses.ct: Iron is dug from the ground, and copper is smelted from ore.

verses.kjv: He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.
verses.ct: Miners push back the darkness, searching to the farthest depths for ore in the deepest shadows.

verses.kjv: The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant; even the waters forgotten of the foot: they are dried up, they are gone away from men.
verses.ct: They cut shafts far from where anyone lives, in forgotten places no foot has traveled — they hang and swing far away from other people.

verses.kjv: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.
verses.ct: The surface of the earth produces food, but underneath it is churned up as if by fire.

verses.kjv: The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.
verses.ct: Its rocks contain sapphires, and its dust holds gold.

verses.kjv: There is a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vulture’s eye hath not seen:
verses.ct: No bird of prey knows the path to these places, and no hawk's eye has spotted them.

verses.kjv: The lion’s whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.
verses.ct: Proud lions have never walked there, and no fierce beast has passed through.

verses.kjv: He putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.
verses.ct: Miners strike their hands against the hard rock and overturn mountains at their base.

verses.kjv: He cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.
verses.ct: They carve tunnels through the stone, and their eyes spot every precious thing.

verses.kjv: He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.
verses.ct: They dam up streams to stop them from flowing, and they bring hidden treasures out into the open.

verses.kjv: But where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of understanding?
verses.ct: But where can wisdom be discovered? Where does understanding reside?

verses.kjv: Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.
verses.ct: No human knows its true value, and it cannot be found anywhere in the world of the living.

verses.kjv: The depth saith, It is not in me: and the sea saith, It is not with me.
verses.ct: The deep ocean says, 'It's not down here,' and the sea says, 'It's not with me.'

verses.kjv: It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.
verses.ct: It can't be purchased with gold, and no amount of silver can match its price.

verses.kjv: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.
verses.ct: It can't be measured against the gold of Ophir, or against precious onyx or sapphire.

verses.kjv: The gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.
verses.ct: Gold and crystal can't compare to it, and it can't be traded for jewelry of the finest gold.

verses.kjv: No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.
verses.ct: Coral and pearls aren't even worth mentioning — the cost of wisdom surpasses rubies.

verses.kjv: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.
verses.ct: The topaz of Ethiopia can't match it, and even pure gold falls short of its worth.

verses.kjv: Whence then cometh wisdom? and where is the place of understanding?
verses.ct: So where does wisdom come from? Where does understanding live?

verses.kjv: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.
verses.ct: It is hidden from the sight of every living creature and concealed even from the birds in the heavens.

verses.kjv: Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.
verses.ct: Destruction and death say, 'We've only heard rumors about it.'

verses.kjv: God understandeth the way thereof, and he knoweth the place thereof.
verses.ct: God alone grasps the way to it, and he knows where it resides.

verses.kjv: For he looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;
verses.ct: For he sees to the farthest edges of the earth and observes everything under all of the heavens.

verses.kjv: To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.
verses.ct: When he established the force of the wind and measured out the waters,

verses.kjv: When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:
verses.ct: when he set limits for the rain and charted a course for the thunderbolt —

verses.kjv: Then did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.
verses.ct: at that moment he saw wisdom and evaluated it; he established it and thoroughly examined it.

verses.kjv: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the LORD, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
verses.ct: Then he told humanity, 'Listen — wholehearted dedication to the LORD, that is wisdom, and turning away from evil is understanding.'
